channel.title: Sarcasmic Industries
channel.description: Creatives services made from scratch by real human beings in Chicago, Ill.

item.title: A Wild Ride
item.content:encoded:
It’s no revelation to state the fact that Covid-19 was tough on musicians, venues and fans. We just wanted to take a minute to thank all the people who helped us feel normal during these decidedly weird last few years. Here’s a gander at a couple of the shows we were lucky enough to play during the pandemic:

And of course, we’re hoping to play some music for you sometime soon. Follow our Instagram, Twitter or Facebook profiles to stay up on the latest!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Woodwindless and Fancy-Free
item.content:encoded:
We were happy to rock out for a good cause at PM Woodwind yesterday. Thanks to those who helped us raise money for Illinois Choice Action Team!

Don’t miss our upcoming show on Feb 27, when we’ll be headlining Montrose Saloon. See you there!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Happy Holidays From Parallelicopter
item.content:encoded: We were proud to be involved in the 20th Annual Rock for Tots show this year! You might have heard about this on the Twitters, but we had a b-side Christmas song battle with The Darkroom Men. Turned out both of us picked the same damn song: Mele Kalikimaka! Enjoy.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: November at The Store
item.content:encoded: Another awesome show at The Store! This one included our pals Ex Maquina! and whitewolfsonicprincess. Thanks to everyone who came out.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Come BYOB With Us in Evanston
item.content:encoded: We're super pumped to play at Chimera Loft, a cool artist studio/event space on Central in Evanston. It’s going to be an intimate show, which is awesome, but that also means that space is limited, so get your tickets today.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: First Gig in Austin, Texas!
item.content:encoded:
Well, it wasn’t SXSW, but it was just as special. Our dear friends Carlo and Natalie got hitched this weekend, and we were lucky enough to be the entertainment for their rehearsal dinner/pool party. We’re not really wedding band material (seems well over half of our songs end in death or divorce) but we managed to find a few ditties to match the occasion. It also offered us the opportunity to get to know the song Never My Love, by the Association. Carlo proposed to Natalie in front of the real band playing that song, so it seemed learning it was the least we could do for these two lovebirds.   

The whole weekend was a total blast, but it’s going to be tough to top playing to an audience of half-submerged, swimsuit-and-floatie-sporting fans. Turns out that applause sounds awesome whether one’s hands are prune-y or not!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Closing Down the Store
item.content:encoded:
We were  jazzed to accompany The Remember Knots in their return from their winter hiatus yesterday. Not only did we get to close the joint down*, but we were able to hear Mr. Camilo Restrepo play his excellent amalgamation of Americana and Chicago blues by way of Bogotá, Colombia. Definitely recommend you check him out.  

*Though it is semi-officially known as “The Store ‘til 4,” we did not actually play music until four in the morning.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Up on the Red Line
item.content:encoded:
We already had plenty of fond memories from the Red Line Tap, a venerable dive bar venue owned by the Rogers Park institution known as Heartland Cafe. In the eight or so years since we moved away from the neighborhood, we've kept coming back. But somehow we missed the revamp that moved the stage to the front and opened up the wall separating the bar and the venue area until we played a gig there last month. As you can see here, it's a lovely switcheroo:

Loving the new-to-us setup at @RedLineTap! #memories Looking forward to a rockin' show w/ @wwsp_theband and more. pic.twitter.com/7mdrN3NxYV

— parallelicopter (@parallelicopter) October 15, 2017

Anyway, we hope you can join us in a couple weeks to see the space for yourself. We're proud to play a benefit for Toys for Tots on Saturday, Dec. 2 with whitewolfsonicprincess and friends. We've got new originals, old favorites, a special guest and even a Christmas carol in store. See you there!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: The Rock 'n' Roll Store
item.content:encoded:
This past weekend we joined the circus—the Rock & Roll Circus at The Store in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood, to be precise. We hadn't had the pleasure of seeing organizers and headliners whitewolfsonicprincess since way back in the Cake & Whiskey days, so that was a clear highlight. But we also were introduced to The Remember Knots, hearing them play their awesome new album from start to finish.

Our set

Love the coziness of the room at The Store!

The Remember Knots

...playing their brand-new album! Definitely want to see these guys perform again. 

whitewolfsonicprincess

That there is Carla, nailing it. 

Spoooooky

These mirrors remind Josh of Disney's Haunted Mansion.  

The crew at The Store is the best!

Our brand-new band sticker graces the sound booth, thanks to Brad. 

We're looking forward to playing the circus again soon, when it makes its way up to Rogers Park's Red Line Tap later this month. Hope you'll join us!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Yippee Ki-Yay
item.content:encoded: It was an absolute honor to play the first inaugural Yippie Fest at the Prop Thtr in Avondale, Chicago last weekend. Many kudos to the dedicated organizers who wrangled more than 80 groups performing theater, music, comedy, and more over three massive days—and without a hitch. We connected with old pals, met some great folks, and had ourselves an excellent time. We can't wait until next year!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Fun at the Cabaret
item.content:encoded: Parallelicopter plays the Gallery Cabaret in Chicago, Ill. on Saturday, May 6.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Come See Us at the Gallery Cabaret!
item.content:encoded:
We're supporting our friends, The River Willows, at the Gallery Cabaret in Chicago, Ill. on Saturday, May 6. We'll take the stage at 9:30pm. Don't miss it!

Check out the event on Facebook for more info. See you there!
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Our Tiny Desk Concert Submission
item.content:encoded: We didn't really stand a chance at winning this time, but we had a new song that was begging to be recorded in real time. We also happened to have a tiny desk (thanks Natalie and Carlo!). But do spend some time with the winners of NPR's most recent Tiny Desk Concert, Tank and The Bangas. They sound amazing and we can't wait to go see them.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: A New Song for the Best Holiday There Is
item.content:encoded:
Is your Halloween playlist missing that special something? Don't you worry your Peter Pumpkin head about it. Parallelicopter's got you covered with a itty-bitty ditty about a little-known horror film afflicted with a small but significant typo.

Enjoy responsibly.

From the depths of the cut-out bin comes the little-known horror film afflicted with a small but significant typo
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: The Cakefather
item.content:encoded:
The Cakefather was Parallelicopter's last Cake & Whiskey gig before the monthly event was brought to a halt by a cease-and-desist notice from a magazine that shall remain nameless (though you could probably venture a guess). The event was held at Act One Pub inside the Mayne Stage Theatre in the Rogers Park neighborhood of Chicago.

Never played a show with the Godfather on mute in the background before, but the crowd was still pretty into our set, classic film notwithstanding. Apparently we made them an offer they couldn't refuse.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Prints for Sale
item.content:encoded:
Want to take it with you?

Almost every show I come home with a photo that should really be hung up on a wall somewhere (or at least monitor wallpaper or a website cover image). Problem is, my walls are almost full. So, I teamed up with MotoPhoto to allow you to order prints and digital downloads from my site, through their print-on-demand service.

Are you a writer for a newspaper, magazine or blog looking for content to accompany your article? Drop me a note (emailjoshhanson[at]gmail.com) and let's work something out.

St. Vincent

St. Vincent at the Chicago Theater, Dec. 2, 2014. More from this show.

St. Vincent

St. Vincent at the Chicago Theater, Dec. 2, 2014. More from this show.

item.title: Pinball
item.content:encoded:
Is pinball's resurgence due to a renewed interest in pop art? Another expression of Gen Xer's desires to extend play into adulthood? The craft movement backlash to an all-digital lifestyle? Whatever the reason, we're the beneficiaries. Chicago, with its half-dozen or so "barcades" opening up in as many years offers a wide range of options for scratching the ever-present pinball itch. Enjoy some of my photographic wanderings through these composite retro/post-modern landscapes here in the Windy City and beyond. 

All rights reserved.

Is the resurgence in the popularity of pinball due to the craft movement backlash to an all-digital lifestyle? Another expression of Gen Xer's desires to extend play into adulthood? Whatever the reason, we're the beneficiaries. Chicago, with its half-dozen or so "barcades" opening up in as many years offers a wide range of options for scratching the ever-present pinball itch. Enjoy some of my photographic wanderings through these composite retro/post-modern landscapes here in the Windy City and beyond.

item.title: Mission-to-Metrics Redesign
item.content:encoded: Copy of Mission-to-Metrics Redesign by Meg White

item.title: Services
item.content:encoded:
Meg White offers a variety of writing, editing, marketing and branding services. As a collaborative partner, she offers a flexible billing structure that allows clients to pay by the project or by the hour, depending on their needs. Each service below includes two rounds of revision (if needed).

Writing

Meg’s writing strengths and work experience focus on real estate, technology and B2B communications, but she’s also proven adept at product descriptions, landing page copy, bios, social media campaigns and even recipes. She creates brilliant copy from scratch, but can also transform your vision—whether sketched on the back of a napkin or just a burning need to communicate an idea—into sparkling copy tailored to your target audience.

Editing

Similar to her writing work, Meg’s editing prowess truly shines when communicating with audiences she knows and loves (real estate agents and brokers, tech professionals and other B2B audiences). But she also has a long history as a beta reader and editor for fiction writers, as well as the main editorial consultant on website redesign projects. She loves any opportunity to apply her strategic mind and editing skills to solve daunting communication problems.

Branding, Marketing & Style Guides

Whether you’re just starting out or looking to scale, clarity around your vision, mission, style and audience is crucial. Having thought through these big questions in-house, via agency work and as a freelancer for a variety of brands, Meg’s consultative process—which focuses on your particular communications goals—will meet you wherever you are in your journey.

item.title: Clips & Work History
item.content:encoded:
Below you’ll find a small sampling of Meg White’s past work. Please get in touch if you’re looking for something more specific.

Technology

  • Going beyond Bitcoin to forecast the potential of blockchain tech

  • Forecasting how connected devices will impact the real estate industry

  • “Where’s my hoverboard?” and other important questions about the future of tech

Editorial Strategy

  • Successfully revamping a mission-to-metrics platform for three different editorial audiences

  • Engaging landing page copy for an innovative tech company in the consumer insights industry

Community Building Profiles

  • An ongoing print, online and video project highlighting the community expertise of real estate pros

  • How can the real estate industry nurture the future of the profession in uncertain times?

Home & Design

  • Examining the draw and challenges of the backyard farm trend

  • Turning architectural passions into a successful niche

Development & Planning

  • A candid live event reveals the fractious relationship between developers and city officials

  • Ever want to become a small-scale community developer? It’s not as hard as you think.

  • The struggles and payoffs involved in implementing net zero in commercial real estate

Branding, Marketing & Sales

  • The highs and lows of marketing and selling historic homes

  • Examining Coldwell Banker’s historic rebrand

item.title: Feedback
item.content:encoded:
Curious what it’s like to work with Meg? Here are some reactions from other real, live people who’ve worked with her in the past.

“Meg is patient, thoughtful, and open to feedback. … She also asks a lot of questions to help me nail down changes I’m going to try to implement. … In short, I’m massively grateful for her! She’s brilliant, and I’d be lost without her guidance and support.”

“Your edits impress me so much because they are small tweaks that pack a big punch. Even your emails blow me away. … I am also grateful for your delivery. When you say you are going to do something, you actually do it.”

“I’ve noticed other editors look to you for confirmation about the nuts and bolts of editing — you notice small details and inconsistencies that they don't even consider. … You excel at leading with solutions. You always bring an idea for every hole you poke, and you take it a step further than that. You bring the idea for the solution as well as ways to implement it.”
